title: Not connected to ETH1. Cannot determine validator ETH1 deposit block number (Geth and Prysm)
body:
I have followed [this link](https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/advanced/proof-of-stake-devnet#adding-prysm-peers-to-your-network) to setup a local geth node on poa and merged it to pos.

My poa chain is running and now is on the edge of merge. 
` WARN [08-31|13:29:21.508] Merge already reached, but no beacon client seen. Please launch one to follow the chain! `

after that, I created my config file for Beacon chain and created the genesis file using this command:
> ./prysmctl testnet generate-genesis --num-validators=1 --output-ssz=genesis.ssz --chain-config-file=config.yml --override-eth1data=true

then I ran my beacon chain and validator chain. becon chain is connected with validator and poa chain for some reason i am getting this error on my beacon chain logs
`[2023-08-31 15:11:37]  WARN rpc/validator: Not connected to ETH1. Cannot determine validator ETH1 deposit block number`

one more thing to add i couldn't understand where the public keys are coming when i run the command:
> ./validator --datadir=validatordata --accept-terms-of-use --interop-num-validators=1 --interop-start-index=0 --force-clear-db --chain-config-file=config.yml --config-file=config.yml

is it like randomly creating those public keys?
